{{Infobox football biography |name = Aboubakar Kamara |image = Aboubakar Kamara, Fulham FC.jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Kamara playing for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] in 2017 |fullname = Aboubakar Kamara{{cite web |url=https://www.efl.com/siteassets/efl-documents/efl-professional-retain-list--free-transfers---2017-18.pdf |title=Club list of registered players: As at 19th May 2018: Fulham |publisher=English Football League |format=PDF |page=16 |accessdate=17 June 2018}} |birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|3|7|df=y}} |birth_place = [[Gonesse]], France |height = 1.77 m |position = [[Forward (association football)|Striker]] |currentclub = [[Yeni Malatyaspor|Yeni Malatyaspor]]
(on loan from [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]]) |clubnumber = 47 |youthyears1 = {{0|0000}}–2014 |youthclubs1 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] |years1 = 2013–2015 |clubs1 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco B]] |caps1 = 26 |goals1 = 15 |years2 = 2014–2015 |clubs2 = [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] |caps2 = 2 |goals2 = 0 |years3 = 2015–2016 |clubs3 = [[K.V. Kortrijk|Kortrijk]] |caps3 = 12 |goals3 = 0 |years4 = 2016–2017 |clubs4 = [[Amiens SC|Amiens]] |caps4 = 45 |goals4 = 15 |years5 = 2016–2017 |clubs5 = [[Amiens SC|Amiens B]] |caps5 = 1 |goals5 = 0 |clubs6 = [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] |years6 = 2017– |caps6 = 45 |goals6 = 10 |clubs7 = → [[Yeni Malatyaspor|Yeni Malatyaspor]] (loan) |years7 = 2019– |caps7 = 0 |goals7 = 0 |club-update = 17:11, 31 January 2019 (UTC) }} '''Aboubakar Kamara''' (born 7 March 1995) is a French professional footballer who plays as a [[Forward (association football)|striker]] for [[Süper Lig]] club [[Yeni Malatyaspor|Yeni Malatyaspor]], on loan from [[Premier League]] club [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]].{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/players/aboubakar-kamara/324040/|title=France – A. Kamara – Profile with news, career statistics and history – Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=2014-10-05}} ==Career== Kamara made his [[Ligue 1]] debut for [[AS Monaco FC|Monaco]] on 12 September 2014 against [[Olympique Lyonnais]] in a 2–1 away defeat. He replaced [[Yannick Carrasco]] after 84 minutes.{{cite web|url=https://int.soccerway.com/matches/2014/09/12/france/ligue-1/olympique-lyonnais/association-sportive-monaco-fc/1686787/|title=Lyon vs. Monaco – 12 September 2014 – Soccerway|publisher=soccerway.com|accessdate=2014-10-05}} On July 2015, Kamara signed a three-year contract with [[Belgian Pro League]] side [[K.V. Kortrijk]],{{cite web|title=KV Kortrijk trekt aanvaller van AS Monaco aan|url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/sportwereld/cnt/dmf20150706_01764473|website=nieuwsblad.be|publisher=nieuwsblad|accessdate=8 September 2015|language=French|date=6 July 2015}} but returned to France only six months later, joining [[Championnat National]] side [[Amiens SC|Amiens]] and helping the club to achieve back-to-back promotions up to [[Ligue 1]].https://www.lequipe.fr/Football/FootballFicheJoueur50513.htmlhttps://www.goal.com/en/news/strasbourg-amiens-promoted-ligue-1-finale/e1sa45mfsqqj1e1atfw2dz9qi Kamara scored the first goal of a dramatic 2-1 win against [[Stade de Reims]] in the last matchday, with Amiens clinching promotion after retaking the lead in the 6th minute of the stoppage time.https://www.goal.com/en-tza/match/reims-v-amiens-sc/lineups/bgw7mnm8l1k5uplbpa4r0hre1 Kamara ended the season as the club's top goalscorer at the [[2016–17 Ligue 2]] with 10 goals.https://www.lfp.fr/ligue2/classementButeurs#sai=100&journee1=1&journee2=38&cat=G&poste=Tous ===Fulham=== On 31 July 2017, Kamara signed for [[Fulham F.C.|Fulham]] for an undisclosed fee on a four-year contract with an option for another 12 months.{{cite web|url=https://www.fulhamfc.com/news/2017/july/31/kamara-signs|title=Kamara Signs|website=www.fulhamfc.com|date=31 July 2017|accessdate=31 July 2017}} He chose to wear the number 47 so that his initials and number would match [[AK-47]].https://www.sofoot.com/aboubakar-kamara-appelez-le-ak-47-446357.html On 23 September, Kamara scored his first goal for the club in a 1–1 draw against [[Middlesbrough F.C.|Middlesbrough]],{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41289622|title=Fulham 1–1 Middlesbrough|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 September 2017|accessdate=2 January 2019}} and three days later, he scored the opening goal in a 3–1 win over [[Nottingham Forest F.C.|Nottingham Forest]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41315214|title=Nottingham Forest 1–3 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=26 September 2017|accessdate=2 January 2019}} On 31 October, he was sent off for shoving [[Bailey Wright]] off the ball, as Fulham lost 2–0 to [[Bristol City F.C.|Bristol City]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41730389|title=Fulham 0–2 Bristol City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=31 October 2017|accessdate=2 January 2019}} He later scored consecutive braces for Fulham in a 2–2 draw with [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] and in a 4–1 win over [[Ipswich Town F.C.|Ipswich Town]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42463026|title=Hull City 2–2 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=30 December 2017|accessdate=2 January 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42481346|title=Fulham 4–1 Ipswich Town|publisher=BBC Sport|date=2 January 2017|accessdate=2 January 2019}} On 20 January 2018, he scored the final goal in a 6–0 win over [[Burton Albion F.C.|Burton Albion]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/42671844|title=Fulham 6–0 Burton Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 January 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} This turned out to be the last goal he scored for Fulham during the 2017–18 season, as he was used sparingly afterwards, with the rest of his appearances coming off the bench. On 5 December, Kamara scored his first goal of the 2018–19 season in a 1–1 draw against [[Leicester City F.C.|Leicester City]],{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46367297|title=Fulham 1–1 Leicester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=5 December 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} and three days later, he scored a consolation penalty in a 4–1 loss to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], after coming on at half-time for [[Aleksandar Mitrović (footballer)|Aleksandar Mitrović]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46409331|title=Manchester United 4–1 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=8 December 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} On 29 December, against [[Huddersfield Town F.C.|Huddersfield Town]], Kamara argued with Mitrović over taking a penalty; his effort was saved by [[Jonas Lössl]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46656880|title=Fulham 1–0 Huddersfield Town|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 December 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} Although Fulham won the match, manager [[Claudio Ranieri]] was angered by Kamara's decision to take the penalty, stating: "He did not respect me, the club, team-mates and crowd. I spoke with him, it is not right". Mitrović was more forgiving of Kamara, referring to a similar incident he had while playing for [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]].{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46711004|title=Claudio Ranieri says he 'wanted to kill' Aboubakar Kamara|publisher=BBC Sport|date=29 December 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} On New Year's Day, Kamara scored against [[Arsenal F.C.|Arsenal]], in a eventual 4–1 loss.{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46677557|title=Arsenal 4–1 Fulham|publisher=BBC Sport|date=1 January 2018|accessdate=2 January 2019}} During January, Kamara had another altercation with Mitrović in a yoga session at the club's training ground, and as a result, was left out of the team squad for Fulham's match against [[Burnley F.C.|Burnley]].{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11681/11607867/fulhams-aleksandar-mitrovic-and-aboubakar-kamara-in-gym-bust-up|title=Fulham's Aleksandar Mitrovic and Aboubakar Kamara in gym bust-up|publisher=Sky Sports|date=15 January 2019|accessdate=23 January 2019}}{{cite web|url=https://www.skysports.com/football/news/11681/11610910/aleksandar-mitrovic-and-aboubakar-kamara-bust-up-played-down-by-claudio-ranieri|title=Aleksandar Mitrovic and Aboubakar Kamara bust-up played down by Claudio Ranieri|publisher=Sky Sports|date=18 January 2019|accessdate=23 January 2019}} Later that month, Kamara was arrested at the club's training ground on suspicion of [[Assault occasioning actual bodily harm|actual bodily harm]] and [[Criminal damage in English law|criminal damage]],{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2019/jan/23/fulham-aboubakar-kamara-arrested-on-suspicion-of-actual-bodily-harm|title=Fulham’s Aboubakar Kamara arrested on suspicion of actual bodily harm|work=The Guardian|first=Sachin|last=Nakrani|date=23 January 2019|accessdate=23 January 2019}} and was "banned indefinitely from all club activities".{{cite news|title=Aboubakar Kamara: Fulham striker arrested on suspicion of ABH and criminal damage |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46978891|publisher=BBC Sport|date=23 January 2019|accessdate=23 January 2019}} ====Yeni Malatyaspor (loan)==== Kamara had been training with the under-23 squad, and, on 31 January 2019, joined [[Yeni Malatyaspor]] on loan until the end of the season.{{cite news |title=Aboubakar Kamara: Fulham striker loaned to Turkish club Yeni Malatyaspor |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/47077017 |accessdate=31 January 2019}} ==Honours== '''Fulham''' *[[EFL Championship play-offs]]: [[2018 English Football League play-offs#Championship|2018]]{{cite news |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/44178427 |title=Aston Villa 0–1 Fulham |first=Phil |last=Cartwright |publisher=BBC Sport |date=26 May 2018 |accessdate=26 May 2018}} ==Personal life== Kamara was born in France and is of Mauritanian descent.{{cite web|url=https://www.chezvlane.com/Aboubakar-Kamara-a-rencontre-Corentin-Martins-le-selectionneur-de-la-Mauritanie_a1229.html|title=Aboubakar Kamara a rencontré Corentin Martins, le sélectionneur de la Mauritanie|first=|last=chezvlane|publisher=}} ==Career statistics== {{updated|2 January 2019}}{{soccerway|aboubakar-kamara/324040}} {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |-
